title: Israel And Hamas Signal Openness To Talks On Gaza War
content: Israel said Thursday its spy chief will attend Gaza ceasefire talks and Hamas vowed to stop fighting if a truce is reached, as long-stalled efforts to end the war appeared to gain momentum.
summary: Israel said Thursday its spy chief will attend Gaza ceasefire talks and Hamas vowed to stop fighting if a truce is reached, as long-stalled efforts to end the war appeared to gain momentum.

title: UN Chief Tells Putin Invasion Of Ukraine Violates International Law
content: UN chief Antonio Guterres told Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday that his invasion of neighboring Ukraine violated the United Nations charter and international law, according to a readout of their meeting.
summary: UN chief Antonio Guterres told Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday that his invasion of neighboring Ukraine violated the United Nations charter and international law, according to a readout of their meeting.

title: 23 Nobel Winning Economists Call Harris's Economic Plan "Vastly Superior"
content: "Vastly superior" is what 15 Nobel Prize-winning economists had called President Joe Biden's economic plan in June, and this is what 23 of them now call Vice President Kamala Harris' plan.
summary: "Vastly superior" is what 15 Nobel Prize-winning economists had called President Joe Biden's economic plan in June, and this is what 23 of them now call Vice President Kamala Harris' plan.

title: Mongolia Failed To Cooperate In Putin Arrest: World Court
content: The International Criminal Court on Thursday accused member state Mongolia of failing to arrest Russian President Vladimir Putin during a trip there last month, and referred the matter for further action.
summary: The International Criminal Court on Thursday accused member state Mongolia of failing to arrest Russian President Vladimir Putin during a trip there last month, and referred the matter for further action.

title: In Obama's Appeal To The Youth, A Thought-Provoking Question On Voting
content: He persuaded people to vote saying, "People vote on everything, they are voting on American Idol, you can vote to decide who's gonna represent you and our country."
summary: He persuaded people to vote saying, "People vote on everything, they are voting on American Idol, you can vote to decide who's gonna represent you and our country."

title: Pinterest Secretly Tracks Users, European Probe On Privacy Reveals
content: Privacy campaigners filed a complaint this week against lifestyle website Pinterest, accusing it of secretly gathering personal data to use for targeted advertising.
summary: Privacy campaigners filed a complaint this week against lifestyle website Pinterest, accusing it of secretly gathering personal data to use for targeted advertising.

title: Kamala Harris Leans On A-List, Trump On Quirky Coterie In Homestretch
content: Kamala Harris has Bruce Springsteen and Eminem. Donald Trump has the world's richest man. But will it make any difference on Election Day?
summary: Kamala Harris has Bruce Springsteen and Eminem. Donald Trump has the world's richest man. But will it make any difference on Election Day?

title: Nepal War Crime Laws May Grant Amnesty To Civil War Offenders: Lawyers
content: Newly amended laws in Nepal to tackle crimes committed during its decade-long bitter civil war could instead deprive victims of justice and grant amnesty to those culpable, rights lawyers warned Thursday.
summary: Newly amended laws in Nepal to tackle crimes committed during its decade-long bitter civil war could instead deprive victims of justice and grant amnesty to those culpable, rights lawyers warned Thursday.

title: "Think He's Sincere": Putin Welcomes Trump's Remark On Ending Ukraine War
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin today said he welcomed "sincere" comments made by Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump about bringing an end to Russia's conflict with Ukraine.
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin today said he welcomed "sincere" comments made by Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump about bringing an end to Russia's conflict with Ukraine.

title: Phones Of Journalists, Politicians Tapped In Mauritius Ahead Of Vote
content: A wire-tapping scandal has rocked Mauritius just weeks before the Indian Ocean island nation goes to the polls.
summary: A wire-tapping scandal has rocked Mauritius just weeks before the Indian Ocean island nation goes to the polls.

title: IMF Chief Seeks More Details On BRICS Payments System Plans
content: The IMF wants to know more about a cross-border payments system discussed by the BRICS group of countries this week and aimed at boosting non-dollar transactions, the Fund's managing director said Thursday.
summary: The IMF wants to know more about a cross-border payments system discussed by the BRICS group of countries this week and aimed at boosting non-dollar transactions, the Fund's managing director said Thursday.

title: "Too Much Immigration": Canada Slashes Immigrant Intake Amid Public Worry
content: Canada said today that it was significantly curbing immigration targets in an effort to "pause population growth," a shift that comes as public support for immigration declines.
summary: Canada said today that it was significantly curbing immigration targets in an effort to "pause population growth," a shift that comes as public support for immigration declines.

title: "Could Make Countries Vulnerable To Coercion": US On China's AI Use
content: The US government is concerned about China's use of artificial intelligence to repress its population, spread misinformation and undermine the security of the United States and its allies, White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan said.
summary: The US government is concerned about China's use of artificial intelligence to repress its population, spread misinformation and undermine the security of the United States and its allies, White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan said.

title: Kamala Harris, Obama Rally With Rock Legend Bruce Springsteen In Georgia
content: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris heads to the battleground of Georgia on Thursday for a star-studded rally featuring rock legend Bruce Springsteen, entertainer Tyler Perry and former President Barack Obama.
summary: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris heads to the battleground of Georgia on Thursday for a star-studded rally featuring rock legend Bruce Springsteen, entertainer Tyler Perry and former President Barack Obama.

title: Climate Set To Warm By 3.1 Degrees Celsius Without Greater Action: UN
content: Current climate policies will result in global warming of more than 3 degrees Celsius (5.4 degrees Fahrenheit) by the end of the century, according to a United Nations report on Thursday, more than twice the rise agreed to nearly a decade ago.
summary: Current climate policies will result in global warming of more than 3 degrees Celsius (5.4 degrees Fahrenheit) by the end of the century, according to a United Nations report on Thursday, more than twice the rise agreed to nearly a decade ago.

title: India, China Achieved Broad Consensus Along Border: Rajnath Singh
content: A broad consensus has been achieved by India and China on restoring the "ground situation" along the Line of Actual Control (LAC) pursuant to talks, including for patrolling and grazing cattle in the traditional areas, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh.
summary: A broad consensus has been achieved by India and China on restoring the "ground situation" along the Line of Actual Control (LAC) pursuant to talks, including for patrolling and grazing cattle in the traditional areas, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh.

title: King Charles' Balmoral Castle In Scotland May Soon Host Exclusive Weddings
content: Britain's King Charles III's remote private estate in the Scottish Highlands could become an exclusive location for weddings, if an application to the local council is approved.
summary: Britain's King Charles III's remote private estate in the Scottish Highlands could become an exclusive location for weddings, if an application to the local council is approved.

title: Pay Up If You Want To See Notre-Dame, French Minister Wants To Tell Tourists
content: France should charge visitors a small fee to see the Notre-Dame cathedral to help the country keep its world-famous churches and cathedrals in shape, the culture minister said.
summary: France should charge visitors a small fee to see the Notre-Dame cathedral to help the country keep its world-famous churches and cathedrals in shape, the culture minister said.

title: "He's A Hero": Nvidia CEO Gets Rock Star Welcome At AI Summit In India
content: Nvidia's leather-jacket-clad CEO Jensen Huang got a rock star welcome at the company's AI summit in India on Thursday, with passes sold out and tech enthusiasts spending thousands of rupees to travel to the event.
summary: Nvidia's leather-jacket-clad CEO Jensen Huang got a rock star welcome at the company's AI summit in India on Thursday, with passes sold out and tech enthusiasts spending thousands of rupees to travel to the event.

title: Pak Ex PM Imran Khan's Wife Bushra Bibi Released On Bail Freed From Jail
content: Bushra Bibi, the wife of former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan, was released from prison on Thursday, a day after she was granted bail in a case linked to the illegal sale of state gifts, ending about nine months of imprisonment.
summary: Bushra Bibi, the wife of former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan, was released from prison on Thursday, a day after she was granted bail in a case linked to the illegal sale of state gifts, ending about nine months of imprisonment.
